title: Can't retrain from snapshot or evaluate after training in colab
body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues

### Bug description

I've been trying to train a model from labeled data on Colab.  I leave it training for iterations until it times out but, after trying to train again from scratch or with weights, I get the following errors. The error is similar when going for evaluating trained models.

Something that I noticed is that the pose_cfg.yaml gets its init_weights field changed back to the resnet file after trying to retrain, so my change to the file seems to not make any difference after all.

I have seen a similar issue in the forum but it did not get solved; removing and installing specific versions of tensorflow only returned a different error. 

It's also worth mentioning that this only happens after a successful (timed out) model training. After I got this I deleted my project folder from Drive, made a new Colab Notebook copy, re-uploaded my project file with only labeled data (no models), and was able to try training again. But got the same error afterwards.

After that I tried deleting only the dlc_models and training_datasets, along with making a new copy of the colab notebook and still got the same error. Only after reuploading the config.yaml file to its original state I could try training again.

### Operating System

Google Colab

### DeepLabCut version

2.2.0.6

### DeepLabCut mode

single animal

### Device type

Python 3 Google Compute Engine backend (GPU)

### Steps To Reproduce

_No response_

### Relevant log output

```shell
Config:
{'all_joints': [[0], [1], [2], [3], [4], [5], [6], [7]],
```

### Anything else?

I had the runtime hanging undefinetely for the DeepLabCut install during the statmodels dependency installation, which I fixed by upgrading pip install. I had errors when creating the training dataset with tables' version but fixed it by upgrading it and then running the DLC pip install again.
